page.title: 04Basingstoke Development
page.content: Basingstoke was a small market town situated in the Loddon valley, with the main A30 road passing through it. The railway provided an efficient link into London. It was decided in the early 1960's to make Basingstoke an overspill town for London. In 1963 the first review Town map was approved setting ot the details of the town's expansion. Of the estates within our area, Popley 1 and 2 received planning permission in 1965. There has been development on the north side of Basingstoke up until the end of the 1970's. There are no further plans to develop this side of the town. There is a policy of maintaining a "Green Belt" between Basingstoke and the northern satellite villages.
